sen.j: 竹田宮（たけだのみや）は、明治後期に北白川宮能久親王の王子、竹田宮恒久王が創設した宮家である。
sen.e: Takedanomiya is a Miyake (family allowed to have the status of Imperial family) created by Takedanomiya Prince Tsunehisa who was a prince of Imperial Prince Kitashirakawanomiya Yoshihisa in the late Meiiji period.

Takedanomiya is a Miyake (family allowed to have the status of Imperial family) created by Takedanomiya Prince Tsunehisa, who was a prince of Imperial Prince Kitashirakawanomiya Yoshihisa, in the late Meiji period.
sen.cmt: 先行詞が固有名詞なので非制限用法に修正しました。スペルミスを修正しました。「Meiiji→Meiji」
sen.e: Takedanomiya is a Miyake (family allowed to have the status of Imperial family) created by Takedanomiya Prince Tsunehisa, who was a prince of Imperial Prince Kitashirakawanomiya Yoshihisa, in the late Meiji period.

sen.j: 初代恒久王は、能久親王の第1王子(庶長子)として、1882年（明治15年）に誕生。
sen.e: The first Prince Tsunehisa was born as the first prince (the eldest child born out of wedlock) of Imperial Prince Yoshihisa in 1882.
The first Prince Tsunehisa was born as the first prince (the eldest child born out of wedlock) of Imperial Prince Yoshihisa in 1882.
The first Prince Tsunehisa was born as the first prince (the eldest child born out of wedlock) of Imperial Prince Yoshihisa in 1882.

sen.j: 1906年（明治39年）に明治天皇より竹田宮（京都市伏見区の地名に由来）の宮号を賜る。
sen.e: In 1906 he was given the Miyago (reigning name) of Takedanomiya (whose origin is the name of the place in Fushimi Ward, Kyoto).
In 1906 he was given the Miyago (reigning name) of Takedanomiya (whose origin is the name of the place in Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City).
In 1906 he was given the Miyago (reigning name) of Takedanomiya (whose origin is the name of the place in Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City).

sen.j: 1908年（明治41年）に明治天皇の皇女・恒久王妃昌子内親王と結婚した。
sen.e: In 1908 he married Imperial Princess Masako who was Imperial princess of Emperor Meiji.
In 1908 he married Imperial Princess Masako, who was an Imperial princess of Emperor Meiji.
sen.cmt: Imperial princess of Emperor Meijiの前に冠詞anを追加しました。先行詞が固有名詞なので非制限用法に修正しました。
sen.e: In 1908 he married Imperial Princess Masako, who was an Imperial princess of Emperor Meiji.

sen.j: 恒久王は、陸軍士官学校、陸軍大学校を卒業後、将校の道を歩み陸軍騎兵大佐を経て、1920年（大正8年）少将に進むが、38歳で死去。
sen.e: After graduating from Military Academy and Army War College, Prince Tsunehisa pursued a career as a military officer, became an army cavalry colonel and advanced to an army major general in 1920, but he died at the age of 38.

After graduating from Military Academy and Army War College, Prince Tsunehisa pursued a career as a military officer, and became an army cavalry colonel and advanced to an army major general in 1920, but he died at the age of 38.
sen.cmt: becameの前にandを追加しました。
sen.e: After graduating from Military Academy and Army War College, Prince Tsunehisa pursued a career as a military officer, and became an army cavalry colonel and advanced to an army major general in 1920, but he died at the age of 38.

sen.j: 昌子妃との間に、恒徳（つねよし）王、佐野常光伯爵夫人となった禮子（あやこ）女王をもうけた。
sen.e: With Imperial Princess Masako he had Prince Tsuneyoshi and Princess Ayako who became the wife of Count Tsunemitsu SANO.
With Imperial Princess Masako, he had Prince Tsuneyoshi and Princess Ayako, who became the wife of Count Tsunemitsu SANO.
sen.cmt: With Imperial Princess Masakoの後ろにコンマ「,」 を追加しました。先行詞が固有名詞なので非制限用法に修正しました。
sen.e: With Imperial Princess Masako, he had Prince Tsuneyoshi and Princess Ayako, who became the wife of Count Tsunemitsu SANO.

sen.j: 2代恒徳王は、1909年（明治42年）に誕生。
sen.e: The second Prince Tsuneyoshi was born in 1909.
The second Prince Tsuneyoshi was born in 1909.
The second Prince Tsuneyoshi was born in 1909.

sen.j: 1919年（大正8年）に父の死去により、わずか10歳で宮家を相続した。
sen.e: In 1919 due to his father's death, he succeeded the Miyake (family allowed to have the status of Imperial family) at the age of only 10.
In 1919 due to his father's death, he succeeded the Miyake at the age of only 10.
sen.cmt: 「宮家」は既出であり、初出の際に英語での補足説明があるため、ここでは補足説明を削除しました。
sen.e: In 1919 due to his father's death, he succeeded the Miyake at the age of only 10.

sen.j: 1934年（昭和9年）に三条公輝公爵の女子・光子と結婚。
sen.e: In 1934 he married Mitsuko who was a daughter of Prince Kinteru SANJO.
In 1934 he married Mitsuko, who was a daughter of Prince Kinteru SANJO.
sen.cmt: 先行詞が固有名詞なので非制限用法に修正しました。
sen.e: In 1934 he married Mitsuko, who was a daughter of Prince Kinteru SANJO.

sen.j: 父宮の遺志を継いで、陸軍に進む。
sen.e: He started his career in the army following his father's will.
He started his career in the army following his father's will.
He started his career in the army following his father's will.

sen.j: 陸軍士官学校、陸軍大学校を卒業。
sen.e: He graduated from Military Academy and Army War College.
He graduated from Military Academy and Army War College.
He graduated from Military Academy and Army War College.

sen.j: 終戦時は陸軍中佐。
sen.e: At the end of the World War II he was a lieutenant colonel of army.
At the end of the World War II he was a lieutenant colonel of army.
At the end of the World War II he was a lieutenant colonel of army.

sen.j: 陸軍騎兵学校の教官をつとめ、太平洋戦争時には、大本営参謀として、ガダルカナル島作戦に参加した。
sen.e: He worked as an instructor at the cavalry school of army and in the Pacific War he took part in the Battle of Guadalcanal as staff officer of the Imperial headquarters.
He worked as an instructor at the cavalry school of army and in the Pacific War he took part in the Battle of Guadalcanal as staff officer of the Imperial headquarters.
He worked as an instructor at the cavalry school of army and in the Pacific War he took part in the Battle of Guadalcanal as staff officer of the Imperial headquarters.

sen.j: 皇族出身の軍人・参謀では出色の才能を持ち、軍首脳部を動かして、1万人の将兵の撤退に尽力した。
sen.e: He had a remarkable talent for a military man and staff officer from the Imperial family, he motivated top military leadership and endeavored to have some 10,000 soldiers evacuated.
He had a remarkable talent for a military man and staff officer from the Imperial family, he motivated top military leadership and endeavored to have some 10,000 soldiers evacuated.
He had a remarkable talent for a military man and staff officer from the Imperial family, he motivated top military leadership and endeavored to have some 10,000 soldiers evacuated.

sen.j: 戦後の1947年（昭和22年）に皇籍離脱。
sen.e: After the war he seceded from the Imperial Family in 1947.
After the war he seceded from the Imperial Family in 1947.
After the war he seceded from the Imperial Family in 1947.

sen.j: 東京都芝 (東京都港区)高輪の宮家本邸が空襲に遭わなかったため、土地の一部を売却して竹田編機という編物機械会社を設立し、事業に着手するが、失敗。
sen.e: As his Miyake Hontei (main residence) at Shiba Takanawa (Minato Ward, Tokyo) was not destroyed in air raids, he sold a part of the land, established a sawing machine company called Takeda Amiki, and started business, but failed.

As his Miyake Hontei (main residence) in Shiba Takanawa, Tokyo (Minato Ward, Tokyo) was not destroyed in air raids, he sold a part of the land, established a sawing machine company called Takeda Amiki, and started business, but failed.
sen.cmt: 地名の前に置く前置詞を修正しました。「at→in」「Shiba Takanawa→Shiba Takanawa, Tokyo」とTokyoを追加しました。
sen.e: As his Miyake Hontei (main residence) in Shiba Takanawa, Tokyo (Minato Ward, Tokyo) was not destroyed in air raids, he sold a part of the land, established a sawing machine company called Takeda Amiki, and started business, but failed.

sen.j: その後、陸軍士官学校時代にスケートを趣味としていたことから、日本スケート連盟会長に就任する。
sen.e: As he enjoyed skating as a hobby while attending the Military Academy, he assumed the President of Japan Skating Federation.
As he enjoyed skating as a hobby while attending the Military Academy, he assumed the President of Japan Skating Federation.
As he enjoyed skating as a hobby while attending the Military Academy, he assumed the President of Japan Skating Federation.

sen.j: これが機縁となって、「スポーツの宮様」として各種のスポーツ振興に取り組むこととなる。
sen.e: Triggered by this, he worked on the promotion of various sports as 'Prince of Sports'.
Triggered by this, he worked on the promotion of various sports as 'Prince of Sports'.
Triggered by this, he worked on the promotion of various sports as 'Prince of Sports'.

sen.j: 体協専務理事、オリンピック東京大会組織委員長、国際オリンピック委員会（IOC）委員を歴任し、国際スポーツ界においても「プリンス・タケダ」として知られた。
sen.e: He served in a variety of posts, including the executive managing director of Japan Sports Association, Chairman of the Tokyo Olympic Organizing Committee, member of the International Olympic Committee (IOC)and was known as 'Prince Takeda' in the international sports community.

He served in a variety of posts, including the executive managing director of Japan Sports Association, Chairman of the Tokyo Olympic Organizing Committee, member of the International Olympic Committee (IOC)and was known as 'Prince Takeda' in the international sports community.

He served in a variety of posts, including the executive managing director of Japan Sports Association, Chairman of the Tokyo Olympic Organizing Committee, member of the International Olympic Committee (IOC)and was known as 'Prince Takeda' in the international sports community.

sen.j: 1992年（平成4年）、82歳で死去した。
sen.e: In 1992 he died at the age of 82.
In 1992 he died at the age of 82.
In 1992 he died at the age of 82.

sen.j: 恒徳王には、竹田恒正、竹田恒治、竹田素子、竹田紀子、竹田恒和の3男2女がいる。
sen.e: Prince Tsuneyoshi had three sons, Tsunetada TAKEDA, Tsuneharu TAKEDA and Tsunekazu TAKEDA, and two daughters, Motoko TAKEDA and Noriko TAKEDA.
Prince Tsuneyoshi had three sons, Tsunetada TAKEDA, Tsuneharu TAKEDA and Tsunekazu TAKEDA, and two daughters, Motoko TAKEDA and Noriko TAKEDA.
Prince Tsuneyoshi had three sons, Tsunetada TAKEDA, Tsuneharu TAKEDA and Tsunekazu TAKEDA, and two daughters, Motoko TAKEDA and Noriko TAKEDA.

sen.j: 三男の竹田恒和（1947年生）は、父と同じく日本馬術連盟で活躍。
sen.e: The third son, Tsunekazu TAKEDA (born in 1947) was active in Japan Equestrian Federation like his father.
The third son, Tsunekazu TAKEDA (born in 1947) was active in Japan Equestrian Federation like his father.
The third son, Tsunekazu TAKEDA (born in 1947) was active in Japan Equestrian Federation like his father.

sen.j: 日本オリンピック委員会（JOC）会長である。
sen.e: He is the Chairman of the Japanese Olympic Committee.
He is the Chairman of the Japanese Olympic Committee.
He is the Chairman of the Japanese Olympic Committee.

sen.j: 恒和の子竹田恒泰（1975年生）は旧皇族の立場から皇位継承問題に関する発言を行っている。
sen.e: Tsuneyasu TAKEDA (born in 1975), a son of Tsunekazu is expressing his opinion on the succession to the Imperial Throne from the standpoint of a former Imperial family.
Tsuneyasu TAKEDA (born in 1975), a son of Tsunekazu, is expressing his opinion on the succession to the Imperial Throne from the standpoint of a former Imperial family.
sen.cmt: 「, a son of Tsunekazu」の後ろにコンマ「,」を付け加えました。
sen.e: Tsuneyasu TAKEDA (born in 1975), a son of Tsunekazu, is expressing his opinion on the succession to the Imperial Throne from the standpoint of a former Imperial family.

sen.j: その他
sen.e: Others
Others
Others

sen.j: 芝 (東京都港区)高輪の宮家本邸は、通商産業大臣官邸に使用された後、西武鉄道に売却され、現在では、高輪プリンスホテルとなっている。
sen.e: After used as the official residence of the Minister of Trade and Industry, the Miyake Hontei (main residence) at Shiba Takanawa (Minato Ward, Tokyo) was sold to SEIBU Railway Co. LTD and is currently (Grand) Prince Hotel Takanawa.

After used as the official residence of the Minister of Trade and Industry, the Miyake Hontei (main residence) in Shiba Takanawa (Minato Ward, Tokyo) was sold to SEIBU Railway Co. LTD and is currently (Grand) Prince Hotel Takanawa.
sen.cmt: 地名の前に置く前置詞を修正しました。「at→in」
sen.e: After used as the official residence of the Minister of Trade and Industry, the Miyake Hontei (main residence) in Shiba Takanawa (Minato Ward, Tokyo) was sold to SEIBU Railway Co. LTD and is currently (Grand) Prince Hotel Takanawa.
